sense.name: explanatory notes/commentary in a document
sense.examples: The footnotes for each chapter are listed at the end of the chapter. There is a brief description of that poem in footnote 4 of chapter two. The footnotes of the book are printed in a smaller font than the main text.

sense.name: a subordinate part of an event, work or field
sense.commentary: FOOTNOTE[+relation][+role][+subordinate][+work/+event/+field] Note: a somewhat figurative extension of Sense 1
sense.examples: It has been said that all of western philosophy is but a footnote to Plato. That battle was only a footnote in the context of the 100-year War. It's a movement now regarded as just a footnote to modern architectural trends.
